Job Description: KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES•	Leads and develops the entire Tour Leader and Event Management team, overseeing all activities of the team in ensuring proper execution of plans and strategy to deliver objectives•	Supervises Tour Leader & Event Management personnel and ensuring accurate execution of their duties. Acts as a mentor to key talents to encourage their professional growth, and to ready them for the succession of higher positions in the future.•	Champions Tour Leader & Event Management skill development to build and improve capabilities through regular Product Trainings, Functional Trainings and partnering with HR to equip necessary soft skill trainings to identified key talents.•	Secures and build sufficient and qualified Tour Leader & Event management talent pool of both internal and external freelancer by ensuring effective allocations of jobs, balancing recruitment of internal resource, attractive yet cost-competitive numeration and benefits and equipping right development programs.   •	Continuously improves Operational Processes and Standards of preparation and coordination of pre and post tour excursion meetings, screening holidaymakers’ profiles (inclusive of special conditions and requests), travel document compliances, resource arrangements, post excursion evaluation, learning logs, post trip reports and compliances to financial policies and memorandums in order to drive excellence and attainment of the desirable long term sustainable customer satisfaction.•	Develops and implements Free Hardship Travel strategy and plan to achieve an improved customer experience in the areas of airport transfer, check in, transits, emigration clearance, luggage claim, lose and found, local guides coordination, hotel check in/out, booking arrangements, hotel and other visiting sites facilities, rules and regulation briefs. These aim at putting customer at peace of mind for choosing to travel with World Pop.•	Plays a leading role in Quality Assurance of customer experience by working closely with sales & services, destination management teams and tour leaders in ensuring actual delivery of accommodation, meal, entertainment, transportation, guide, tourist attractions visits and all activities of the excursion meet predefined standard. Variations from standard quality are to escalate to appropriate levels and coordinate immediate trouble shooting when requires.•	Assist marketing team in development of pictural and video marketing contents by coordinating the collections of footages, filming and shooting of the targeted destinations. Coordinates with marketing team to confidentially identify and engage enroute customers who are the key opinion leader and public figure to help promoting World Pop in their social networking platforms.•	Spearhead Brand Ambassadorship among all Tour Leaders and Event Management team to convey accurate and appropriate key Brand Message, CSR initiatives and other tailormade customer dialogue programs to the holidaymakers as per predefine and agreed Standard Talks.  •	Keeps the Head of Operation, Chief Operating Officer and Director of Sales & Services abreast of changes in the destination inclusive of new legislations, regulations, new competitor activities, new destination tourist attractions and ideas for new itinerary creations.
Job Requirement: JOB REQUIREMENTSEducation:Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, preferably Tourism and Hospitality Management. The equivalent of the same in practical experience is also acceptable. Experience:At least 3 years of working experience in relevant fieldsThe candidate will also be better suited with experience in travel industry.MS Office and Software:Possess good computer skill, being proficient in Digital Social Apps, Ms Excel, Ms Outlook, and PowerPoint, which will all be necessary for the effective performance of the creation of reports, proposals and recommendations.**Other SkillsKnowledge of and interest in the history and travel, effective in handling multiple projects and meeting tight deadlines, be results and detail oriented, be self-starter, be proactive, going beyond the call of duty, be a person of high integrity, be comfortable working in a highly collaborative setting, has an ability to learn and adapt quickly, has exceptionally good problem-solving skills, be an outspoken and comfortable in dealing with partners.Exceptionally good leadership in both people and strategic skill, portraying an ability to influence a cross-functional teams and senior leadership teams as well as stakeholders in a unified direction and with common vision.Confident yet likable and relatable individual who is able to form strong and meaningful relationship with others which will inspire trust and confidence.

Job Description: Coordinator for food safety/ food quality project- Monitor/report the implemented Procedure for any corrections- Develop and apply HACCP documents- Update Material Specification Forms- Verify and Keep records of HACCP, GMP, or external documents- Provide training such as GMP, GHP, and HACCP to relevant staffs- Response training staff about Hygiene or safety in the factoryWorking Location:- at Kampong Spue Province (Kilomet #29)
Job Requirement: • Bachelor’s degree in QA/QC or related fields • Have at least 6 months experience in QC or related fields • Have a good communication, influencing skills, hardworking, and honesty• Good knowledge of computer applications MS office, Internet, Email & Outlook• Be able to work under pressure, tight timeline, strong Interpersonal skill
Company Profile: Khmer Foods Group is a leading rice miller and exporter having its rice mill located in Battambang, Kompongspue, and Phnom Penh. We are recruiting for talented and challenging candidates to fill many positions.

Job Description: Corporate/Group Food Safety regulations.●   Work with the Unit Organizations Management team to maintain high standard of hygiene and food safety regulations●  Manage the Company’s Business Continuity Management plan.● Develops, implements, and conducts safety training programs in conjunction with the training department. Training programs target all employees and ensures compliance with company new-hire, as needed, and annual refresher requirements. Special focus on Production Department.● Ensures compliance with company food safety policies and procedures, and company developed food safety best practices through audits, support departmental managers and participation in meetings● Provides guidance, direction, and leadership in developing, maintaining, and improving Units HACCPteam to enhance Hygiene/Food Safety awareness among all staff.●  Executes the required food safety related testing as defined in HACCP plan and maintains the revisions of the HACCP plan.●  Leads all QA and food/product safety related activities/initiatives.●  Participates in regulatory agency inspections/audits and develops and implements corrective actions.●  Reviews changes to company’s Food Safety / HACCP materials and tools (e.g., HACCP Plan/ Food SafetyCCPs and SOP,) to ensure that key content is complete and accurate. ●  Monitors safety performance and identifies trends and opportunities for improvement●  Implementation of quality systems and measures its effectiveness by verifying activities, controls and preventative measures.●  Responsible for maintaining and managing the corrective action system and facilitating corrective action activities with management.●  Assures the accuracy and compliance of HACCP records as defined in the corporate procedures.●  Drives implementation of the business management system●  Ensures all food safety complaints are investigated and documented to determine root causes and assists unit and department management with developing corrective action plans to prevent reoccurrence. Communicates required prevention steps by providing Food Safety Alerts, and Shift Briefings to department management.●  Responsible for the identifying and maintaining of key performance metrics for the Quality organization●  Continuously improves unit procedures for monitoring and ensuring conformance to specifications for incoming raw materials as well as for finished products and is responsible for the local supplier approval.●  Provide strategic and practical support on security system design and implementation.●  Any other business-related tasks that may include cross functional work as per the business requirements.12.Other task from assigned by top management.Working Location:- at Kampong Spue Province (Kilomet #29)
Job Requirement:
• Bachelor degree in QA & QC or related fields 
• Year 4/5 student and having experience in QA/ QC
• Have good communication, interpersonal skill, influencing skills, hardworking, and honesty
• Good knowledge in English both written and verbal communication
• Good knowledge of computer applications MS Office, Internet, Email & Outlook
• Be able to work under pressure, tight timeline, strong Interpersonal skill
Company Profile: Khmer Foods Group is a leading rice miller and exporter having its rice mill located in Battambang, Kompongspue, and Phnom Penh. We are recruiting for talented and challenging candidates to fill many positions.

Job Description: KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES•	Executes and manages new product innovation (NPI), modification to existing products; changes to asset base of product, technology, and processes for the assigned products to deliver targets.•	Monitors and evaluates product performance to propose improvement plan and execution. Handles end-to-end product management and launches according to approved plan and budget.•	Contributes and assists Destination Management colleagues in new product development processes of making new tour packages, different types of tour programs and local destination packages, assembling various travel components into final products and formulating new tour itineraries for sales and marketing teams to market with compelling propositions and competitive cost advantages to meet customized requests and expectation of customers.•	Conducts market studies and monitor key competitors’ products performances to submit timely market intelligent reports and recommendations to further enhance own product performance. Manages own products budget and produces product performance reports in a complete, accurate, and timely manner.•	Updates detail information about the responsible tour products, costing [tour cost calculation] and pricing [tour fare], destinations details, destination products, modes of travel, accommodation and foods, sightseeing, immigration, health and security rules about various permits required to travel, other optional tours and all other available options, tour leader brief, tour leader standard talk; and shares regularly and timely with relevant team members and cross departments to obtain superior product and service performance.•	Keeps the team abreast of changes in the industry inclusive of legislations, regulations and ensures that all Sales transactions across the section are in legal compliance.•	Collaborates with relevant stakeholders in ensuring accurate representation and maintenance high level of business integrity in the industry by ensuring compliance with legislation and internal policy.
Job Requirement: JOB REQUIREMENTSEducation:Bachelor’s degree in business administration, preferably Tourism and Hospitality Management. The equivalent of the same in practical experience is also acceptable. Experience:At least 1 years of working experience in relevant fields.The candidate will also be better suited with experience in travel industry.MS Office and Software:Possess good computer skill, being proficient in Digital Social Apps, Ms Excel, Ms Outlook, and PowerPoint, which will all be necessary for the effective performance of the creation of reports, proposals, and recommendations.OtherEffective in handling multiple projects and meeting tight deadlines, be result and detail oriented, be self-starter, be proactive, going beyond the call of duty, be a person of high integrity, be comfortable working in a highly collaborative setting, has an ability to learn and adapt quickly, has exceptionally good problem-solving, selling and negotiation skills, be an outspoken and comfortable in dealing with major clients.Exceptionally good communication skill, portraying an ability to influence a cross-functional teams and senior leadership teams as well as stakeholders in a unified direction and with common vision.Confident yet likable and relatable individual who can form strong and meaningful relationship with others which will inspire trust and confidence.

Job Description:
•	Research and develop marketing opportunities and plans, monitor trends, forecast the market, coordinate marketing with other departments and measure marketing performance.
•	Develop key customer relationships and acquire new clients and communicate customers’ concrete requirements.
•	Develop and manage the sales & marketing budget and oversee branding, advertising, promotional campaigns, and execution of all marketing events as business requirements.
•	Manage budgets, quotas, and goals and follow up the overdue payments and solve problems with relevant departments.
•	Provide clear information about the requirements for quantity, quality and strength of concrete from customers and coordinate with the production team to ensure that we have enough raw material to supply at a certain time as required.
•	Provide clear information on machinery types that customers need for concrete supply and work closely with the logistic team to check and prepare for the concrete supply.
•	Coordinate with the construction site in case of requesting labor assistance to facilitate the work of machinery installation.
•	Work closely with the technical team to prevent any technical issues with concrete and report to the technical team for immediate solutions if any issues occur.
•	Work closely with quality control, operations, safety customer service and credit.
•	Manage, motivate and coach sales and marketing team to produce high productivity and team morale.
•	Perform other tasks as assigned by the line manager.
Job Requirement:
•	Bachelor's degree in Marketing or Business Administration or a related field
•	Experience in cement, concrete, admixtures, concrete, or masonry construction 
•	Experience in planning and implementing sales strategies
•	Experience in customer relationship management
•	Experience managing and directing a sales team
•	Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English and Chinese is plus
•	Dedication to providing great customer service
•	Ability to lead a sales team.

Job Description:
1. Team Management:
-Supervise and lead involved in various market operations.
-Set clear performance expectations, provide feedback, and conduct regular performance evaluations. 
-Foster a positive and collaborative team culture that encourages growth and development.

2. Operational Efficiency: 
-Develop and implement operational procedures and workflows to streamline processes. 
-Monitor operational performance, identify areas for improvement, and implement corrective actions.
-Ensure all activities are carried out in compliance with company policies.

3. Tenant Relations:
-Maintain strong relationships with tenants and partners.
-Address tenant inquiries and concerns promptly and professionally.

4. Leasing and Marketing:
-Develop strategies to attract and retain tenants.

5. Reporting and Analysis: 
-Prepare and analyze operational reports to track KPI. 
-Use data-driven insights to make informed decisions and drive operational improvements.
Job Requirement:
-Bachelor's degree in Business Administration or a related field.
-Proven experience in operations management or a similar role.
-Strong leadership and team management skills, excellent problem-solving skills.
-Proficiency in MS, social media and marketing tools.

Job Description:
•	Responsible for mix designs, cost reduction and assist in pricing exercises and act as the first point of communication contact for internal and external clients, manage documents and customer complaints.
•	Manage raw materials for proper inspection using equipment following ASTM-C33 material standards to ensure all material tests are correctly conducted and supported by documentary evidence and that calibrated equipment is used.
•	Work closely with Branch Managers to provide needed resources to drive operations to high-class performance levels including benchmarking them against industry standards and key competitors.
•	Strengthen technical knowledge and practice in producing accurate Mix Design standards guaranteed and the quality of supply to customers and provide additional knowledge to employees to understand the technique.
•	Identify and improve a safe working environment in the operation and report procedures of the business and maintain QA records and testing standards.
•	Ensure new or revised QA documentation is issued to staff and provide continuous assessment and improved QA and QC systems and performance.
•	Develop new procedures as required to comply with any new material test standards.
•	Maintain and further develop policies in dealing with the Health & Safety of employees for the company and working proactively for the company in its efficient and effective implementation.
•	Strengthen knowledge for Team Sales to understand concrete, quality of strength, timing, and maintenance knowledge of concrete and explain to the customers.
•	Provide a good solution and specifications, clearly, standard with knowledge and expertise.
•	Oversee the authorization of reports and client inquiries regarding technical issues and concerns.
•	Conduct regular team meetings to find solutions for any challenge and bring or propose solutions to management. Train technical work for the team following the company's human resources development plan.
•	Improve the ineffective areas and strengthen the team to increase work efficiency and provide relevant evaluation, KPI, appraisals and deal with operational staff issues.
Job Requirement:
•	Bachelor/Master's degree in civil engineering or related technologist/technician.
•	At least 5 years experience as a QA/QC Manager, Technical Services Engineer or Certified Concrete Technologist in the building materials industries (cement, concrete, admixtures, concrete, or masonry construction).
•	Admixture products application technology
•	Technical aspects of customer’s products, systems, building products and applications
•	Knowledge of cement products application technology.
•	Interpersonal skills including conflict resolution
•	Strong oral and written communication skills
•	Honest, self-motivated, hardworking and responsible person with good character and morality.

Job Description:
I. Strategic Partner 
•	To collaborate with business leader to ensure that business, investments has established work plan that align with top management and business objective.
•	To facilitate Annual Work Plan with Investment project and support GM’s performance tracking.
•	To support and give recommendation for BU leader/GM/Operation Manager on HR (talent needs, capability development, and other).
•	To review and conduct progression work plan with business leader monthly and annually.
•	To produce summary progression work plan report monthly, annually.
•	To assist HRBP Manager to adjust HR strategic to response business needs & assessing the HR implications of strategic options.
II. Talent Management (Succession Planning) 
•	Review and identify critical role within company/business/project.
•	Facilitate Individual Development Plan (IDP) each successor with Line Manager and L&D Department.
•	Keep track and record of each successor Individual Development Plan (IDP) progression.
•	Produce progression report of successor Individual Development Plan (IDP).
III. Organization Development
•	To review & analyze on Manpower needs of assigned projects.
•	To analyze and draw project organization chart effectively.
•	To collect and review on Job Description of the company/business/project;
IV. Career Advisory Club
•	Be a career advisor to provide CAC service for MAM and Projects (target clients: talented candidates, walk-in candidates, internal transfers, internal recruitment).
V. Policies / HR Tools Development 
•	To lead and develop Functional Competency for the management positions (Based on the list of critical position planning program approved by the Director).
•	To collaborate with HR Division/Investment/Projects for implementing;
VI. Performance Management
•	Track performance and consolidate report for all property management and investment.
•	Assist and oversee on property management and investment projects; both commercial and residential on performance improvement to ensure staff effectiveness and productiveness.
•	KPI collection, verification, and evaluation of all projects under responsibility.
•	Mid-year and annual KPI consolidate report.
•	Work with relevant heads of GM, Property Manager, Sales Manager to set PIP, track, evaluate, and recommendation.
•	Take disciplinary action, staff warning and termination.
VII. New Staff Probation Management
•	Check, verify and make recommendation on staff probation KPI Setting (Supervisor level up).
•	Check and verify probation evaluation result based on supporting documents accurately and effectively.
VIII. Staff Movement Management
•	Check, verify and make recommendation on Salary Increment request accurately and effectively.
•	Check, verify and make recommendation on Staff Promotion request accurately and effectively.
Job Requirement:
•	Bachelor or Master Degree in Human Resource Management, Business Administration, or related field.
•	At least 3 years of work experience in the HR field.
•	Proven expertise in developing HRM policies, procedures and strategies in multi-business company.
•	High standard of attention to detail.
•	Ability to influence and persuade senior management level.
•	Excellent communication, diplomatic and organization skills.
•	Ability to work under pressure and with personnel from all levels.
•	Tact and the ability to deal with difficult situation.
•	Strong understanding in Cambodian Labor Law and Legal Compliance.
•	Good resource allocation skills.
•	Good command in English and Chinese is an advantage.

Job Description:
1./ Leading, Managing, Supervising and handling the work of projects and general administrative works at office: 
-	Assit top managements, relevant divisions and committees, on leading, managing, supervising and handling the work of projects and other other tasks assigned by director.
-	Assit top managements, relevant divisions and committees on preparing policy and work plans to manage, supervise and handle the work of projects and other tasks assigned by director.
-	Authorized to oversee and manage staffs under monitering, administrative works, tecnical works, maintenance, and all kind of works of site projects and company which clearly defined new job responsibility and duty.
-	Check and verify on the signature of payment requests, salary increment of staffs and workers for projects which existing in new job responsibility and duty.
-	Check and verify on structural analysis and design work, renovation work, structural assements for projects which existing in new job responsibility and duty.
-	Every checked and verified work has to prepare report to director or electrical reporting if necessary. 

2./ Check and evaluate on technical works and projects management:
-	Inspect on construction work activities and solve the problems at construction site of the construction teams.
-	Check and review layout for all technical works.
-	Inspect on construction work of contractors and sub-contractors.
-	Check, coordinate and recommend on layouts and detailed designing of achiectural, structural, civil engineering, mechanic, electrical, and interior & exterior design. 
-	Coordinate, check and integrate the detailed drawing layout for construction.
-	Ask for questions to clarify any questions related to the detailed drawing and additional or detailed where necessary. 
-	Evaluate and recommend to materials that can be replaced.

3./ Check, evaluate master plans in term of working such as designing, and construction works of projects:
-	Check on daily and weekly detailed construction reports of construction projects.
-	Check and analyze on monthly detailed construction report of construction projects.
-	Attend weekly or monthly meeting with OCIC project counsil and prepare report to share to stakeholders.
-	Prepare monthly report that included designing, process of construction, variation of master plans, expenditure and verify of impact or delay of the projects, and other problems which related to projects, comment and solve the problems if necessary.

4./ Inspect, evaluate and verify about the quality of construction of the projects to top management:
-	Inspect, evaluate the quality of construction based on technical standards and methodology of construction to manage the works.
-	Inspect, evaluate the quality of construction based on  determined time and plans of projects. 
-	Inpsect on construction quality management, safety, environment and hygienic of projects construction.
-	Inspect, evaluate the quality and result of testing of all kind of construction materials.

5./ Check, evaluate and recommend on the expenditure, cash payment requests, expense list, budget plan and bidding of site projects:
-	Check and evaluate on BOQ of site projects.
-	Check and evaluate on OT and Manpower list of staffs and workers, BOQ, OT Claim Request, and OT Budget Plan and Manpower Plan.
-	Check and evaluate on Variation Oder or VO of projects and team of contractors.
-	Check and analyze on bidding and recommend to top management.
-	Check on evaluation of designing which is requested by bidder.
-	Check and evaluate on bidding reports and the aggreement of contractors. 

6./ Assist top Management and director on managing and leading Construction Project Management for Asset & Properties Division and CNB Bank’s projects:
-	Lead on Construction Project Management for Asset & Properties Division and CNB Bank’s projects to finish align of top management’s planning. 
-	Lead, check and evaluate on BOQ, Claim Request, Budget Plan, and Variation Oder or VO of projects and team of contractors.
-	Lead, check, evaluate and analyze on bidding then recommend to top management.
-	Lead and prepare management planning to coordinate and manage projects since Feasibility study step tills Complition and Handover step.
-	 Lead and prepare project reports to top managements and relevant department.

7./ Support and cooperate with HR Division to study and evaluate performance of any site projects: 
-	Prepare, check and revise Yearly KPI Standard for Supervisor up to SM/PM at site projects.
-	Assist on study, check and evaluate competency and performance of staffs at site projects.
-	Cooperate with HR Division to study and check of Manpower Plan and Staff Assessments of site projects.
-	Cooperate with HR Division to evaluate staffs’ yearly KPI of site projects.
-	Support, cooperate with HR Division to attend the meeting in order to solve any problems of site projects.
-	Assist on study and evaluate Best Project Management of site projects.

8./ Lead and organize Topo & Surveying Work for other site projects under management of MAM. Real Estate Department OCIC and all subsidiaries of Canadia Group to be accuracy and timely according to technical standard and the date set by management, chairman, and as the request of the lawyer of the company and the relevant department.  
-	Assist on organize and manage the measurement team in a timely manner on the land survey study of Real Estate Department of OCIC and All subsidiaries of Canadia Group. 
-	Organize the use of standard skilled machines, including reports and layouts as desired by the project owner and management.
-	Study accurately, clearly and provide timely reports and recommendation to management, company lawyer and relevant departments. 

9./ Attend meeting, coordinating, and handling issues with Management of OCIC & MAM, relevant departments and project managers. 
-	Attend meeting, coordinate, and handle issues with project managers and management if necessary.
-	Attend weekly or monthly meeting with project council of OCIC and prepare reports to share to stakeholders.
-	Attend meeting, coordinate and handle issues with management of CNB Bank and stakeholders. 
-	Prepare briefly reports related to meeting by describe about work issues and solutions, and the deadline with stakeholders then prepare the reports to director or electrical reporting if necessary. 

10./ Other works assigned by managements and director
Job Requirement:
-	 Bachelor’s Degree of Civil Engineering (Master or Doctoral is plus).
-	Knowlegdes of the construction process of structuring, mechanic, electricity, architecture, analyisis, and design in construction or real estate industry. 
-	Minium 15 years working experience in construction projects, and with minium 05 years experience of planning, leading and controlling of construction projects.
-	Knowledges of Ms. Office, Ms. Project, Internet and email, AutoCAD, Structural analysis and Design softwares, BIM Aplications…
-	Skill in problems solving. 
-	Skill in Planning and Schedule.
-	Talent in leading and managing Construction Project.
-	Skill, knowledge and good experiences in leading of QS and Cost Control Work.
-	Knowledge and good experience of checking and verifying Topo and Surveying Work.
-	Knowledge and certificate of construction law of Cambodia.
-	Certificate of certified and Professional Engineer and Certificate of Structural Design.
-	Knowledge of Structural Analysis and Design of Building’s Sub and Supper Structures, and Foundation, Steel Structures, PT Structures.
-	Knowledge and good experience of human resource management.
-	Skill in communication both Khmer and English (Chinese is an advantage).
-	Active in work and able to work under pressure.
-	High professional work ethic.

job title: Laundry Operations Manager $350-$700 (competitive salary based on experience)
position: Laundry Operations Manager $350-$700 (competitive salary based on experience)
Job Description:
Job Requirement Summary
We are seeking a highly-organized and experienced Laundry Operations Manager to oversee all aspects of our laundry facility. The ideal candidate will have a proven track record of optimizing laundry processes, managing staff, and ensuring exceptional quality standards.

•	Production Management: 
o	Oversee daily laundry operations, including scheduling, workflow, and quality control.
o	Develop and implement SOPs (standard operating procedures) to streamline laundry processes.
o	Troubleshoot and resolve production bottlenecks or issues efficiently.
•	Staff Management: 
o	Hire, train, and supervise laundry staff (washers, pressers, drivers, etc.).
o	Conduct performance reviews, provide feedback, and address any personnel issues.
o	Create staff schedules and manage shift assignments.
•	Inventory Control: 
o	Manage the procurement, storage, and usage of detergents, cleaning supplies, and other necessary materials.
o	Track inventory levels and place orders as needed.
•	Equipment Maintenance: 
o	Schedule preventative maintenance and repairs for laundry equipment.
o	Coordinate with vendors or technicians for timely repairs and maintain records.
•	Quality Assurance: 
o	Implement and enforce strict quality control standards for all cleaning and pressing services.
o	Address customer complaints promptly and professionally.
•	Report Generation: 
o	Track key performance metrics (e.g., production output, turnaround times, costs).
o	Prepare reports for management on operational efficiency and areas for improvement.
Job Requirement:
•	Education: 
o	A high school diploma or equivalent is generally required
•	Experience: 
o	Minimum of 5 years of experience in laundry operations, including 3 years in a supervisory or managerial role.
o	Experience in [commercial / residential] laundry setting is preferred.
•	Skills: 
o	Strong leadership and organizational skills.
o	Excellent problem-solving and decision-making abilities.
o	Knowledge of laundry processes, equipment, and cleaning chemicals.
o	Ability to effectively manage budgets and control costs.
o	Attention to detail and commitment to quality.
o	Proficient in computer software (e.g., laundry management software, spreadsheets).

Additional Desired Qualities:
•	Certification in laundry management or related fields.
•	Experience in a fast-paced, customer-focused environment.
•	Bilingual, ability to read, write and speak English/Chinese is a plus.

Working Hours:
•	Term : Full Time, Monday – Saturday 

Compensation and Benefits:
•	Salary $350-$700 (competitive salary based on experience)
•	Bonus: 13th Month Salary
•	Benefit: work insurance (NSSF)
•	Annual Leave 18 days
•	Public Holidays following the calendar
How to Apply:
•	recruit@tianlong.com.kh
Contact Info: Contact Information HR  015 222 179 recruit@tianlong.com.kh No. 44, St. 606, Sangkat Beung Kok 2, Khan Toul Kok, Phnom Penh, Cambodia 015 222 179

Job Description:
** Job purpose and brief
Purpose: To improve the quality of services to trafficking survivors, in Ratanak and nationally, through analysis and development of internal and national policy.

* Brief: The National Technical Support Project Manager is responsible for understanding and improving the national frameworks for anti-human trafficking work with a consistent focus on improving the experience of human trafficking survivors. They will review and compare Ratanak’s work to national standards and identify both gaps and learning from front-line staff work. This will involve managing project staff, overseeing all relationships with government partners, and advocating for positive change.

- Manage staff, providing clear leadership, standards and support.
- Ensure clear systems and project activities are in place, understood and followed.
- Review and analyse national policy documents related to Ratanak’s work, and relevant research and practice from Asia and globally.
- Oversee implementation of the research strategy, including primary research conducted within Ratanak.
- Generate learning based on primary and secondary research , documenting the experience of
trafficking survivors and gaps against policy and best practice.
- Analyse reports to identify patterns of information. Summarise results of analysis into documented conclusions, with clear recommendations and action steps to address identified issues.
- Collaborate with relevant stakeholders to draft policy and procedure documents at the national level, ensuring alignment with existing policy and best practice.
- Represent Ratanak at national and regional meetings, presenting research results, recommendations and policy issues.
- Contribute to technical working groups at department and ministry level to improve the quality of care for trafficking survivors.
- Ensure consistent engagement with all relevant government groups and bodies at national and regional level, overseeing a clear strategy in this area.
- Develop and improve the procedures and tools for relevant ministry departments as defined in annual plans, including supporting database/client management systems implementation.
- Provide clear information for the production of Ratanak reports to International Headquarters in Canada, other country offices and required Cambodian government offices in line with agreed standards and timelines.
- Develop the scope and quality of communication materials produced for International Headquarters
- Manage the project budget effectively to ensure spending is monitored and on target, alerting relevant staff to any concerns.
- Organize and attend meetings and briefings with Ratanak staff according to the relevant terms of reference to ensure excellent communication and coordination.
- Attend and make strategic contributions to the Ratanak senior management team, including developing immediate and long-term plans related to the program.
- Engage in ongoing personal development to ensure a comprehensive knowledge of key issues and policy related to providing excellent care and reintegration to survivors of exploitation and trafficking.

If the job description above is a good fit for you and you want to apply, we would be delighted to hear from you. We especially welcome applications from women and other under-represented groups; growing and promoting a diverse team is a core value for us.

Please email your CV and our short application form (attached below) to the email address mentioned in the contact details. There is no need to include a cover letter, but the application form is required. Please do not include certificates or other documents at this time. 

We value all applications but will only contact those shortlisted for interview. Please note this is a advertisement – previous applicants need not apply.
Job Requirement:
* Essential:
- Degree and/or post-graduate qualification in social work, psychology or other relevant field. 
- At least 3 years experience of working with government agencies. 
- At least 3 years experience in program management in a relevant sector 
- Knowledge of government formats and protocols 
- Fluent in English (equivalent to IELTS Level 6 or above) 
- Experience of using MS Office suite of programs to communicate and manage information effectively in a range of contexts. 
- At least 2 years of active membership in a church community. 

* Desired:
- Experience of developing policy at the national level. 
- Thorough knowledge of national policies on trafficking and the rights of trafficking survivors 
- Experience of developing tools and policies related to victim identification and protection. 

* Attitudes and skills
- Uses a systematic approach to improve client services
- Promotes diversity
- Addresses conflict and strengthens the team
- Assesses and responds to underlying issues
- Develops learning plans and creates opportunities
- Analyses results to achieve effective achievement of goals
- Writes at a publishable level
- Develops long term strategies to improve ethical understanding
- Builds coalitions
- Challenges stakeholders for growth
- Embraces vulnerability
- Develops team
- Allocates appropriate resources and ensures quality delivery
- Ensures good stewardship of funds through effective planning and monitoring
- Effectively supports performance improvement
-  Follows up development results

Job Description:
Job brief: The Community Project Manager is responsible for the oversight of all long term community clients in the Ratanak Achievement Program, ensuring that project plans are completed on time and that project goals are met effectively.
They are responsible for managing staff and budget and ensuring reports are delivered on time. This involves promoting the program and coordinating with a wide range of stakeholders in Cambodia and internationally, while
maintaining a focus on excellent client care.

* Key responsibilities:
- Manage staff, providing clear leadership, standards and support.
- Ensure clear systems and project activities are in place, understood and followed.
- Establish and maintain comprehensive operational policy and procedures for delivering services, ensuring these are implemented and reviewed regularly.
- Ensure effective delivery of the program in line with the log frame and operation plan, identifying potential improvements or problems. Make recommendations for project re-design and other actions to address these issues.
- Ensure implementation of an effective framework and tools for monitoring the impact of the program.
- Identify organizational issues impacting on service delivery and make recommendations for program re-design and other actions to address these issues
- Evaluate competency standards for different roles, using the established performance management system and supporting others to use this system effectively.
- Provide clear information for the production of Ratanak reports to International Headquarters in Canada, other country offices and required Cambodian government offices in line with agreed standards and timelines.
- Manage the project budget effectively to ensure spending is monitored and on target, making adjustments at mid-year and alerting relevant staff to any concerns.
- Be aware of relevant government bodies and other organizations working in the same field, coordinating with other projects to represent the program at national and international level as appropriate, and raising any field level concerns that need
addressing.
- Organise and attend team meetings and briefings as needed to ensure excellent communication across all staff within the project and with other teams.
- Attend and make strategic contributions to the Ratanak senior management team, including developing immediate and long-term plans related to the program.
- Engage in ongoing personal development to ensure a comprehensive knowledge of key issues related to Ratanak’s strategy and best practice in caring for survivors of trauma
and those who have experienced exploitation.

Job Description:
Travel requirements: Regular travel to the provinces with overnight stays (8-15 days/ month)
Additional benefits: 13-month salary, health allowance & insurance, meals (Breakfast & Lunch), self-care allowance and education allowance.

** Job purpose and brief:
Purpose: To provide therapeutic support to female and male clients that enables them to achieve

greater well-being, especially in emotional, social, and spiritual areas.

Brief: Therapists have a focus on working with clients on their emotional needs, in the context of a trauma informed care approach. They are responsible for assessment of clients as well as families in this area and for providing a range of therapeutic approaches to support healing and restoration. This involves working closely with the wider team of caregivers and case managers, and promoting strong trauma informed care by all staff, while managing assessments and interventions with a specific caseload of clients and their families.

- Duties: Coordinate and deliver client need assessment, and assessments of family/ community situations with respect to emotional and social issues.
- Formulate action plans in consultation with clients that address both short and long-term needs.
- Deliver regular individual and group therapy sessions to clients using a variety of tools and approaches.
- Ensure that planned interventions involving other staff or agencies are carried out, supporting clients with legal, police and other meetings as required.
- Monitor and assess clients' progress towards agreed goals, including revising plans and interventions in response to the results of this monitoring.
- Keep consistent and comprehensive records regarding action taken and assessments made in line with Ratanak policy and guidelines.
- Support, encourage and correct home advisors and other staff involved in client’s emotional care.
- Actively engage with partner agencies who provide therapeutic services, including coordination meetings and regular updates. Address any gaps in or problems with client care and services.
- Attend team meetings, case conferences and team briefings, including planning and strategy meetings as required.
- Engage in ongoing personal development to ensure best practice in therapeutic work and management of self and workload.
Job Requirement: Experience and knowledge Essential:• Degree and/or post-graduate qualification in Psychology, social work, counseling, or relatedfield.• At least 3 years experience of using therapy within a context of trauma recovery.• Experience with use of tools for client assessment.• Experience working in a residential and community setting.• Experience in facilitation in reflective practice, linking interactions to the theory of trauma,attachment, and human development.• Experience of working with NGOs and Mental Health Clinics.• Thorough knowledge of using IT.• Experience of or willingness to engage with personal therapy.Desirable:• Experience and knowledge of trafficking and exploitation issues.• At least 2 years of active membership in a church community.** Application information If the job description above matches your skills, experience, and interest, we would be delighted tohear from you. Please email your CV and a covering letter explaining how you meet the requirements for this role to the email address mentioned above. Please do not include certificates or other documents at this time. If you have any questions about the position, please contact us at the same email address or phone number. We value all applications but will only contact those shortlisted for interview.ATTACHMENTJD_Therapist_ENApplication Form

Job Description:
• Contract Negotiation and Review: Draft, review, negotiate, and advise on contracts with suppliers, customers, employees, and other third parties. Interpret contracts and advise on rights and obligations to avoid potential disputes.
• Legal Advisory Services: Provide accurate and timely counsel to CBC management and teams on a variety of legal topics.
• Compliance Management: Monitor compliance with internal policies and procedures, as well as applicable laws and regulations. Educate and train employees on compliance-related matters to prevent legal liabilities and ensure business activities are conducted legally.
• Dispute Resolution: Address legal disputes and manage litigation or potential litigation, either directly or in liaison with external counsel, and develop strategies to resolve disputes in a cost-effective and timely manner.
• Risk Management: Identify potential legal risks and propose mitigating actions. Conduct and coordinate risk management and control activities such as due diligence for business transactions.
• Regulatory Monitoring: Keep abreast of legislative changes that could affect the company and advise on the legal impact of new laws on the business.
• Employee Relations: Advice on HR matters, including employee contracts, termination processes, and employee disputes. Ensure the company's employment practices are compliant with labor laws.
• Intellectual Property Management: Manage the process of protecting intellectual property, including patents, trademarks, copyrights, and trade secrets.
Job Requirement:
• Law Degree (LLB) from a recognized university
• Licensed to practice law in Cambodia or eligibility for licensing
• 3-5 years of legal experience, preferably in corporate law or commercial law
• Experience in the beverage industry, FMCG, or related sectors, and multinational corporations is advantageous
• Expertise in contract law, including drafting, reviewing, and negotiating
• Knowledge of Cambodian business law, labour law, environmental law, etc.
• Skills in dispute resolution (negotiation, arbitration, litigation)
• Ability to provide strategic legal advice aligned with business objectives
• Proficient in risk management
• Fluency in Khmer and English and strong interpersonal and communication skills
• Understanding of local and international laws impacting the business
• Experience dealing with local government bodies and regulatory agencies
• Strong problem-solving skills
• Ability to handle multiple tasks and adapt to changing environments
Company Profile:
Cambodia Beverage Company Ltd (CBC) referred too locally as Coca-Cola Cambodia is a leading manufacturer & distributor of non-alcoholic ready to drink (NARTD) beverages throughout Cambodia. With our state-of-the-art bottling plant (commissioned in 2016) situated within PPSEZ, one of the leading Economic Zones in Phnom Penh.

The company produces 16 different beverages, under 8 brands, and within 5 different NARTD categories (Sparkling, Tea, Energy, Water, and Isotonic) which is supplied to our customers throughout the Kingdom.
CBC directly employs more than 850 staff while creating indirect employment opportunities for another 8,000+ staff across the Kingdom.

We are proud that >99.7% of our workforce are Cambodian nationals and that >31% of our staff are female, with women making up 37% of the senior management team. We are committed to increasing our female diversity and are targeting to have 50% female staff by 2030.
We are committed to integrating sustainability into everything we do.

By 2030 we aim to collect and recycle a bottle or can for each one we sell by 2030 and use at least 50% recycled material in our packaging.
We are committed to return to nature and communities 100%+ of the water we use in our drinks and their production. We are working to increase water security where we operate, source ingredients, and touch people's lives.
Contact Info: Contact Information TALENT ACQUISITION TEAM  096 48 99 677 / 012 916 444 hrd@coca-cola.com.kh No.287, National Road 5, Mittapheap Village, Russey Keo District, Phnom Penh,  Kingdom of Cambodia. 096 48 99 677 / 012 916 444

Company Profile:
RMA entered the Cambodian market in 1992 as an exclusive provider of dedicated system solutions for commercial and non-commercial enterprises in the sectors of infrastructure, energy and logistics. Gradually, the company has been growing alongside the development of Cambodia and expanded to automotive, agricultural and heavy equipment, warehouse solutions, financial services, car rental and food franchise management.  In addition to business expansion, RMA Cambodia has also focused its attention on human resources by providing internships and employment opportunities to approximately 2,000 local and professional staff with a number of expatriates working together to share their skills and expertise.

RMA Cambodia has also been very active within local communities. We consistently work with local authorities and organizations to provide financial and technical assistance in essential key sectors, such as health, environment, education and sports.

We aim to help Cambodia grow and prosper.

OUR SERVICES AND PRODUCTS:

RMA Cambodia and its affiliate Asia Vehicle Rental (AVR) are offering franchised car rental services through the global brand AVIS. Rentals are customized with brand-new Ford vehicles and experienced English-speaking chauffeurs. AVIS also offers car rental and leasing that meets all types of customers requirements for business trips, leisure or field work, with or without chauffeurs.

RMA Cambodia has a financing arm, RMA Financial Services, offers financing solutions to flexibly meet the needs of corporate and retail customers for the purchase of their own automotive and heavy equipment, agricultural machinery and warehouse solution equipment.

RMA Cambodia is also a provider of heavy equipment products and solutions in construction, road building and maintenance, and agriculture, namely JCB, Mitsubishi FUSO and John Deere. RMA Cambodia is an agent for the world’s leading brands in these industries.
Contact Info: Contact Information EFG Cambodia   017 888 349 efgcareer@rmagroup.net #320, Mao Tse Tong Blvd, Sangkat Tek Laak 1, Khan Toul Kok 017 888 349

Job Description:
- Lead and manage a team responsible for the recovery of non-performing loans and write off clients.
- Representing the company in the recovery process to enhance recovery performance and productivity.
- Ensuring effective company recovery operations contribute to both short-term and long-term strategies.
- Possessing a deep understanding of asset financing business and its nature.
- Implementing strategies to improve the recovery team's performance and achieve key performance indicators (KPIs).
- Investigating and negotiating with Non-Performing Loan (NPL) customers (Late 90 – 360 days) to settle overdue amounts or secure property.
- Investigating all write-off clients (Over 360 days) to seize the property.
- Stay abreast of industry developments, regulatory changes, and best practices in debt recovery to continuously improve processes and outcomes.
- Managing the repossession of assets including vehicles, tractors, heavy equipment, and other equipment.
- Engaging legal procedures and sending court letters to NPL customers.
- Providing judgment, managing legal proceedings, and following up on court cases.
- Collaborating with local authorities, agencies, municipal police, and courts to locate and repossess assets.
- Working closely with company lawyers to handle clients, issue letters, negotiate special agreements, and oversee relevant tasks.
- Restructuring plans for NPL clients experiencing reduced income.
- Willing to travel to 25 cities and provinces.
- Undertaking other tasks relevant to the recovery function and disciplines.
Job Requirement:
- At least bachelor degree of law, business, management, marketing, banking and finance or communication. 
- Master degree is preferable.
- Travelling to all provinces of Cambodia
- Travelling to abroad for further meeting, training and introduction with BSP and RMA Group.
- Understanding legal process and Cambodia law.
- Investigation and negotiation skill.
- Understanding banking and financial sector.

Company Profile:
RMA entered the Cambodian market in 1992 as an exclusive provider of dedicated system solutions for commercial and non-commercial enterprises in the sectors of infrastructure, energy and logistics. Gradually, the company has been growing alongside the development of Cambodia and expanded to automotive, agricultural and heavy equipment, warehouse solutions, financial services, car rental and food franchise management.  In addition to business expansion, RMA Cambodia has also focused its attention on human resources by providing internships and employment opportunities to approximately 2,000 local and professional staff with a number of expatriates working together to share their skills and expertise.

RMA Cambodia has also been very active within local communities. We consistently work with local authorities and organizations to provide financial and technical assistance in essential key sectors, such as health, environment, education and sports.

We aim to help Cambodia grow and prosper.

OUR SERVICES AND PRODUCTS:

RMA Cambodia and its affiliate Asia Vehicle Rental (AVR) are offering franchised car rental services through the global brand AVIS. Rentals are customized with brand-new Ford vehicles and experienced English-speaking chauffeurs. AVIS also offers car rental and leasing that meets all types of customers requirements for business trips, leisure or field work, with or without chauffeurs.

RMA Cambodia has a financing arm, RMA Financial Services, offers financing solutions to flexibly meet the needs of corporate and retail customers for the purchase of their own automotive and heavy equipment, agricultural machinery and warehouse solution equipment.

RMA Cambodia is also a provider of heavy equipment products and solutions in construction, road building and maintenance, and agriculture, namely JCB, Mitsubishi FUSO and John Deere. RMA Cambodia is an agent for the world’s leading brands in these industries.
Contact Info: Contact Information RMA CAMBODIA  070790890 recruitment.kh@rmagroup.net #27, St. 134, SangkatMittapheap, Khan 7 Makara, Phnom Penh 070790890

Job Description:
-Issue all the internal Invoices for each AFS Retail/KA workshops.
-Manage all the expenses of AFS department on day to day basis.
-Process the quotation for external customer which is call in and walk in to our AED office.
-Follow up with customers regularly on parts that they request for price and quotation pending.
-Perform other duties as assigned by Customer Service Manager.
-Schedule for Mobile team and making an appointment with customer in daily basis.
-Follow up with customer to ensure the satisfaction after mobile team visited.
-Ensure all customer expectations and requirements are exceeded throughout.
-Promotion of sales of genuine parts and accessories whenever possible, acting on opportunities to sell additional products and services.
-Handling customer complaints and ensure all filing is kept up to date
-Follow up customer in the areas that we have planned the technicians in that areas
-Solving some technical problem related to Computer problem and network (Service & Parts ADVISOR).
-Being able to solve some basic technical issues of customer products.
-Manage the cash advance for all technicians in Workshop PP and plan before the trips start.
-Follow up with the account team to collect the pending payment from AFS team and customers.
-This position normally not requires much travelling to provinces, but will have to in case any urgent requirement by business or requested by Managers.
Job Requirement:
-Education/Certification:
-Graduated University in Administration, Finance, or related fields.
-Knowledge, Skill, and Experience:
-Basic technical knowledge and experience at least 2 years in this field
-Be able to use Email, Microsoft Office, especially Excel.
-Know about management skill is advantaged.
-Good command in communicating in Khmer and English.
-Have excellent communication skills, as well as an aptitude and great attitude to learn and develop.

Please send your CV to:
chansokha.hou@rmagroup.net

Job Description:
- Assist in executing all marketing communication activities    such as writing and proofreading creative copy for all marketing    collaterals including but not limited
  to digital content, promotional literature, brochures, leaflet,    PR, newsletters, and other POSM.
- Assist and coordinate the process for event planning,    arrangement, and reporting.
- Maintain the continuous awareness of competitive products,    pricing and performance for a market potential response to customer inquiries
- Monitoring ongoing expenses against the budget, keeping accurate records and highlighting where variances occur.
- Handle and oversee all the company's social media accounts to improve online presence and the company's product and service to the market as well as generate leads.
- Monitor competition and provide suggestions for improvement in both offline and online marketing activities.
- Promote company products and execute other tasks assigned by the manager
Job Requirement:
- 1- years in marketing or related experience.
- Strong attention to detail
- Fresh Graduate are encourage to apply
- Good knowledge of all different digital marketing channels.
- Good knowledge and experience with online marketing tools 
  and best practices
- Results driven, able to make sound judgments over competing 
  priorities and good organization and planning skills
- Forward-thinking and proactive
- Good time-management skills
- Great interpersonal and communication skills
- Knowledge and sound understanding of heavy equipment    
  products
- Numerical skills
- Basic Designing and video making is a plus

Job Description: - Act as a ‘subject matter expert’ in your area of expertise, sharing that knowledge with your team and colleagues.- Ensure you continue to develop your knowledge and expertise through your own ‘personal career development’ and utilizing training and development offered by the company.- Act as an advocate for the company, promoting it internally and externally. This includes creating and managing any social media to ‘share, like, and comment’ on the company’s published content.- Commit to implement the "Official Job Commitment" Strongly.- Co-ordinate with the Marketing Department closely in terms of sharing information and initiative ideas to improve business.- Enthusiastic for keep learning about company processes and standards, technical knowledge, market knowledge, and competitors.- A key focus will be sales growth, ensuring that strong sales processes are in place. Key focus on workshop sales and wholesale channel.- Working with the Marketing Manager and General Manager in advising and taking the lead in suggesting and executing innovative marketing and sales ideas.- Be a crucial part of a motivated management team, you will be expected to analyze and compile sales competitor market information.- Working closely with all clients (internal or external) to ensure all orders are managed efficiently and agreed deadlines are achieved.- Enthusiastic for keep learning about company processes and standards, technical knowledge, market knowledge, and competitors.- Prepare daily, weekly, and monthly reports as required.- Ensure financial targets (revenue, margins, etc.) are achieved.- Take responsibility for sales budgeting, ensuring ethical and group compliance, and providing regular and timely sales reporting.- Maintains agreed profit margins and return on investment by selling the maximum amount of parts.- Manages budgetary spending targets, discussing significant variations with the General Manager.- Report to General Manager, based in Phnom Penh.- Develop relationships with team members, hands-on approach, and internal training.- Coordinates with the Service Department, Marketing Department, Body Shop, General Manager, and sales representative to ensure the effectiveness of the sales department.- To assist the General Manager in managing the showroom team and support another sales team when needed.- Build rapport and customer relationships and qualify the customer's requirements.- Maintains a professional manner and high standards of personal presentation at all times.- Works as a full member of the dealership team.- Departs from traditional ways of doing things as appropriate to ensure maximum customer satisfaction, loyalty, and sales- Work with outsourced service centers, sub-dealers, and other corporate customers to understand their requirements to increase sales.- Coordinates order and delivery. Ensure pre-delivery inspections and agreed repairs/servings are carried out before delivery.- Liaises with administrative colleagues to ensure product availability fits with Changan standards, places the order, updates customer records, and schedules any complementary services/additional work to be completed on the vehicle.- Maintains contact with the customer to ensure they are kept fully informed throughout the sale and pre-delivery process, notifying them of any changes and arranging a convenient handover.- Develop relationships to win new business - managing relationships, prospecting, and handling inquiries.- Manages the display of products and merchandise. Ensure vehicles are presented professionally at all times.- Works with colleagues across the Dealership to deliver improvements and provide a seamless service to customers.- Works with colleagues across the Dealership to investigate and resolve customer complaints.
Job Requirement: - To do market research / visit regularly to understand market needs and competition.- To visit each CHANGAN branch at least once a week.- To visit CHANGAN workshops in provinces, outsource service centers, sub-dealers, and other corporate partners at least once every quarter.- Participates in overseas meetings/training as assigned by management.- Bachelor's Degree in sales and marketing, or related field or higher level.- Proven track record in a fast-growing business and ability to sell to both technical and executive audiences and Networks.- Strong in sales analytical skills, well understanding of sales strategy, and knowledge of business management.- Excellent communication skills and good technical knowledge, coupled with a dynamic approach to sales and business development.- Excellent for both English (written, listened, and spoken).- 3 years in Automotive Sales or equivalent experience.- 2-3 years of supervisory / management level experience.-Excellent in communication (Verbal, written, listening, and presentation).- Well organized when working under pressure.- Able to demonstrate problem-solving with high-quality independence.- Change management skills, excellent team player, Training and coaching skills.- Excellent at Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook email).

Job Description: - Understand the features and benefits of the Changan offer (vehicles, Service costs, and plans, warranty, accessories) and how these compare with other premium automotive brands.- Uses an understanding of the offer and the Changan brands to develop a distinctive and compelling sale proposition for corporate customers.- Formulate annual marketing plan and annual budget while also ensuring plan executive.- Keep the information of the automotive industry updated and actively seek feedback and input from the Sales Team for marketing activities and competitor information.- Understands and uses a range of local marketing activities (e.g. events, advertisements, fliers, website page,driving events) to develop new business including developing relationships with advertising agencies, media, and key stakeholders to promote the public image of Changan.- Researching, tracking, and updating the management on all political and economic issues in Cambodia, mainly related to the automotive industry as well as changes in the competitive environment for vehicles in Cambodia.- Purchasing and inventory control of branded stationary, giveaways, and other premium items Led and coached the marketing and sales team in order to carry out the plan by creating and implementing product training.- Regular reporting of marketing activities and competitive activities to the management.
Job Requirement: - Full understanding of product ranges available to customers.- Knowledge of Changan Customer First Behaviors- Knowledge of Changan Operational Guidelines and Standards.- A minimum of 3-5 years of Marketing Management experience (automotive).

Job Description:
- Representing the company in the recovery process with the aim of enhancing recovery performance and productivity.
- Ensuring the effective functioning of the company's recovery efforts to align with both short-term and long-term strategies.
- Having a solid understanding of asset financing business and its nature.
- Learning strategies to improve the performance of the recovery team and achieve KPIs.
- Investigating and negotiating with NPL customers (Late 90 – 360 days) to settle overdue amounts or secure property.
- Investigating all write-off clients (Over 360 days) to recover the property.
- Stay abreast of industry developments, regulatory changes, and best practices in debt recovery to continuously improve processes and outcomes.
- Handling repossessed assets such as vehicles, tractors, heavy equipment, and other equipment.
- Initiating legal proceedings and sending lawyer and court letters to NPL customers.
- Providing judgment, managing proceedings, and following up on court cases.
- Collaborating with local authorities, agencies, municipal police, and courts to locate and repossess assets.
- Working closely with company lawyers to address client issues, issue letters, negotiate special agreements, and manage relevant tasks.
- Restructuring plans for NPL clients experiencing reduced income.
- Willingness to travel to 25 cities and provinces.
- Undertaking other tasks relevant to the recovery function and disciplines.
Job Requirement:
- At least bachelor degree of law, business, management, marketing, banking and finance or communication. 
- Travelling to all provinces of Cambodia.
- Travelling to abroad for further meeting, training and introduction with BSP and RMA Grou.p
- Understand legal process and Cambodia law.
- Understanding banking and financial sector.
Company Profile:
RMA entered the Cambodian market in 1992 as an exclusive provider of dedicated system solutions for commercial and non-commercial enterprises in the sectors of infrastructure, energy and logistics. Gradually, the company has been growing alongside the development of Cambodia and expanded to automotive, agricultural and heavy equipment, warehouse solutions, financial services, car rental and food franchise management.  In addition to business expansion, RMA Cambodia has also focused its attention on human resources by providing internships and employment opportunities to approximately 2,000 local and professional staff with a number of expatriates working together to share their skills and expertise.

RMA Cambodia has also been very active within local communities. We consistently work with local authorities and organizations to provide financial and technical assistance in essential key sectors, such as health, environment, education and sports.

We aim to help Cambodia grow and prosper.

OUR SERVICES AND PRODUCTS:

RMA Cambodia and its affiliate Asia Vehicle Rental (AVR) are offering franchised car rental services through the global brand AVIS. Rentals are customized with brand-new Ford vehicles and experienced English-speaking chauffeurs. AVIS also offers car rental and leasing that meets all types of customers requirements for business trips, leisure or field work, with or without chauffeurs.

RMA Cambodia has a financing arm, RMA Financial Services, offers financing solutions to flexibly meet the needs of corporate and retail customers for the purchase of their own automotive and heavy equipment, agricultural machinery and warehouse solution equipment.

RMA Cambodia is also a provider of heavy equipment products and solutions in construction, road building and maintenance, and agriculture, namely JCB, Mitsubishi FUSO and John Deere. RMA Cambodia is an agent for the world’s leading brands in these industries.
Contact Info: Contact Information RMA CAMBODIA  070790890 recruitment.kh@rmagroup.net Phnom Penh #27, St. 134, SangkatMittapheap, Khan 7 Makara, Phnom Penh 070790890

Job Description:
• People management: responsible for the organization and performance of a growing team of after sales service personnel – including both in field & workshop activities. 
• Implementing and maintaining activity and other company management systems as required assisting in the overall management of this support division. 
• Identifying appropriate training and staffing requirements to meet both existing and future needs. 
• Actively striving for best practices in customer satisfaction and support with regular updates to management on appropriate recommendations
• Preparation of operational and capital budgets as required and actively striving to meet targets.
• Ensuring customer service performance by service personal is professional and appropriate to support business growth, brand differentiation, sales margin and customer loyalty.
• Optimizing spare parts stock levels, costs and availability for customers buy regularly reviewing on items of concern. 
• Efficient management and scheduling of resources for the maintenance, service and other operations as required by GM. 
• Identification of materials, parts and equipment for purchase to achieve value for money.
• Interact at a management level with all departments to ensure seem-less flow for work performance and information is maintained at all times. 
• Developing and implementing the necessary infrastructure and processes to support future growth. This includes systems, procedures, customer service, training, management information and performance controls. 
• Develop manage and deliver efficiency KPI’s for the After Sales Service Department in conjunction with the General Manager.
• Actively solicit additional business for the After Sales department.
• Report monthly on overall  P & L of After Sales business
Job Requirement:
• Bachelor degree in related field 
• Highest level of business ethics  
• Excellent  English (written and spoken)
• Fully conversant with Microsoft suite of products and fully computer literate.

Job Description:
Overview of the role.

This role is responsible for strategic analysis and review of business development opportunities for the group. This will include building relationships with both new and existing OEM's, creating business plans, negotiating contractual arrangements, and determining operational needs to execute.

Key objectives

General Management

- Action as the interface for ongoing OEM relationships, ensuring that the business maximizes its outcomes and portfolio.
- As the Group BD lead, this role will also contribute as the face of the group in both CSR and relevant business forums, ensuring that our activities and future plans are both relevant, visible, and where required being advocated for desired outcomes.
- To identify business opportunities, potential growth areas, and prospects through his network and other sources.
- To develop and maintain business relations with prospects and clients.
- To provide information on business opportunities to Management, Division Managers, and other people involved in business development.
- To assist the Divisions, Department, and Section Managers in negotiations and solving problems with the clients.
- This role will also be responsible for other RMAC projects that are determined by Group CEO and Country Manager Cambodia, as required.
- Internal and External Interactions.
Country Manager, Division General Managers, CFO, GMHR, Bangkok Group Office (CEO, COO, CFO).
- Business Councils / Forums (AMCHAM, BRITCHAM, etc), OEM's, relevant government departments, and Media.
Job Requirement:
- Relevant Degree qualifications (Business, Law, Commerce, Finance etc) and additional educational qualifications are a plus (MBA).
- Minimum of 5 years of experience in business development, sales, or a related role.
- Strategic thinker with the ability to identify and capitalize on market opportunities.
- Results-driven with a focus on achieving targets and driving business growth.

Job Description:
Key Responsibilities

- Warm welcome customer walk-in & Call-in for both Phnom Penh & Province
- Follow 10 steps showroom walk around

- Monthly sales by product and model 
- Maintain sales by revenue 
- Find new prospect customers 
- Handling with any other tasks directed by Marketing Manager 
- Understanding and sharing industrial market and competitor’s information, have to update immediately in any information that related with the industrial market and sharing to sales team, management, and people who related 
- Cost saving (related to business operations) have to save cost in every using of electric, telephone, aircon, water, LCD, Demo car in an important case, brochure, leaflets, any material sales and marketing tools, taking care of computer, stationary, keep workplace tidy and clean…,etc

jobUrl: https://www.camhr.com/a/job/10584340?title=ផ្នែកលក់​​ និង ផ្សព្វផ្សាយ (តាមស្រុក)
job title: ផ្នែកលក់​​ និង ផ្សព្វផ្សាយ (តាមស្រុក)
position: ផ្នែកលក់​​ និង ផ្សព្វផ្សាយ (តាមស្រុក)
Job Description:
• បង្កើត និងរក្សាទំនាក់ទំនងល្អជាមួយអតិថិជនមានស្រាប់ និងអតិថិជនថ្មី
• រៀបចំផែនការចុះជួបអតិថិជននិងធ្វើរបាយការណ៍លក់ប្រចាំថ្ងៃ
• ស្វែងយល់ស្ថានភាពទីផ្សារនៃដៃគូរប្រកួតប្រជែង និងធ្វើបច្ចុប្បន្នភាពបញ្ជីអតិថិជនជូនប្រធានគ្រប់គ្រងផ្នែកលក់។
• អាចបំពេញការងារផ្សេងៗដែលបានដាក់ចេញដោយប្រធានគ្រប់គ្រងផ្នែកលក់
Job Requirement:
- ត្រូវមានបទពិសោធន៍ផ្នែកលក់យ៉ាងតិច 1ឆ្នាំ
- មានអត្តចរិតរស់រាយរាក់ទាក់
- មានភាពក្លាហាន
- ត្រូវមានភាពស្មោះត្រង់
- ចេះទំនាក់ទំនង
- មានទំនួលខុសត្រូវចំពោះការងារ

*ទីតាំងតាមស្រុក៖
- ស្រុកស្ទឹងត្រង់
- ស្រុកឈូក
- ស្រុកត្រពាំងបា្រសាទ
- ស្រុកវ៉ារិន
- ស្រុកបវេល
- ស្រុកសំបូរ
- ស្រុកកោះធំ
- ស្រុកស្អាង
- ស្រុកមុខកំពូល,
- ស្រុកកោះអណ្ដែត
- ស្រុកបាទី
- ស្រុកពេជ្រាដា

Job Description:
- Maintain awareness of new and emerging technologies and potential applications on customer projects. 
- Ensure we continually refine and develop our product portfolio, acting as a conduit back to the management team providing knowledge and feedback of client-required enhancement and future needs based on an extensive knowledge of our client and their products. 
- Possesses a thorough understanding of our capabilities 
- Maintain up-to-date knowledge of the Principle/ Competitor development and technical advance. 
- Identifying appropriate training and staffing requirements to meet both existing and future needs.
- Execute sales plan to target all Products and Target prospects with a view to developing ongoing relationships as a key supplier of customers.
- Preparation of quotations to all customers In line with company policy and directives. Responsible for all sales executives quotations and all will need a From General Manager.
- Work closely with the AFS team to provide solutions to customers who require these services.
- Preparation of operational, capital budgets, and sales forecasts as required and activity striving to meet targets.
- Succession planning of responsible workforce.
- People management: responsible for the organization and performance of a growing team of sales personnel.
- Be solution-driven; focus on finding the right solution for long-term customer relationship development. 
- Sell in the consultative sales solution manner with the Partnering approach.
- Develop pricing models for competitors across the various industries we operate.
- Assist in the implementation and operations of Group projects and business as necessary.
- Meet and exceed sales volume Key performance indicators (KPI)/Objectives.
- Performance as advised by the General Manager.
- Report, any tasks assigned and assist the General Manager.
- Collaborate with the sales and Marketing terms.
- Maintain a close working relationship with the Administration and Others Dept.
- Closely liaise with the Aftersales and other departments as necessary.
- Develop and maintain relationships with key customers.
- Develop and maintain relationships with major dealerships and dealership organizations.
- Activity engages with Industry, Government, Non-Government & Private related organizations.
Job Requirement:
- At least 2-3 years of experience in Sales, marketing, or a related area.
- Bachelor’s degree in Sales, Marketing, or a related field.
- Knowledge of machinery is the best.
- Strong organizational skills.
- Strong interpersonal and communication skills.
- Language Proficiency in both English and Khmer in verbal and written communication.
- Advanced level in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, and PowerPoint)
